DataElement.preferredName: Non-Protocol Therapeutic Procedure Chlorhexidine Gluconate During Intensive Care Unit Performed Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to a treatment not specified in a protocol by having the gluconate salt form of chlorhexidine, a biguanide compound used as an antiseptic agent with topical antibacterial activity in a health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non-Protocol Therapeutic Procedure Chlorhexidine Gluconate During Intensive Care Unit Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a treatment not specified in a protocol by having the gluconate salt form of chlorhexidine, a biguanide compound used as an antiseptic agent with topical antibacterial activity in a health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Chlorhexidine Gluconate During Intensive Care Unit Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: The gluconate salt form of chlorhexidine, a biguanide compound used as an antiseptic agent with topical antibacterial activity. Chlorhexidine gluconate is positively charged and reacts with the negatively charged microbial cell surface, thereby destroying the integrity of the cell membrane. Subsequently, chlorhexidine gluconate penetrates into the cell and causes leakage of intracellular components leading to cell death. Since gram positive bacteria are more negatively charged, they are more sensitive to this agent.:At some point in a given period of time.:A health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: The gluconate salt form of chlorhexidine, a biguanide compound used as an antiseptic agent with topical antibacterial activity. Chlorhexidine gluconate is positively charged and reacts with the negatively charged microbial cell surface, thereby destroying the integrity of the cell membrane. Subsequently, chlorhexidine gluconate penetrates into the cell and causes leakage of intracellular components leading to cell death. Since gram positive bacteria are more negatively charged, they are more sensitive to this agent.
At some point in a given period of time.
A health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
